review: It took about a month or 45 days to receive due to the popularity, but this was worth the wait.The unit is small, well built and has a USB cable and plug in charger. This requires a powered USB port on a TV.The unit required to be reset in order for me to set it up initially.The chromecast works well with my android and iOS phone. I am able to also broadcast my Chrome browser onto the TV. This mimics the Airplay functionality built into MAC OS X. The fluidity is a little rough and I'm not gonna say it's bad...but it's not as good as my Apple TV.Overall, for $35 this is an amazing value for a decent product. Google is at the front, pushing to expand it's product line and value for their services. I will keep this Chromecast in my suitcase for travel, enabling me to turn any hotel TV into a SMART TV with Netflix and (eventually) Hulu.

review: This works great for streaming Netflix, Google Play and even web sites via Google Chrome but it does not support Amazon Instant Video via an app or through web site casting.  The site itself can be "cast" but the video content can not.  This is very disappointing as it was the main reason I wanted this device.  I'd rather not have both Netflix and Instant Video and this could be the reason I switch when my free trial ends.
